snippet: To win help with the migrant crisis, Europe seems prepared to overlook what critics say is President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s march toward authoritarianism.
abstract: European leaders, desperately in need of Turkey's help in handling refugee crisis, are ignoring mounting abuses under Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan; plight is exemplified by European Union's offer of additional aid and other concessions to Turkey days after Turkish government crackdown on opposition newspaper Zaman.

byline.original: By TIM ARANGO and CEYLAN YEGINSU

lead_paragraph: To win help with the migrant crisis, Europe seems prepared to overlook what critics say is President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s march toward authoritarianism.

headline.main: E.U. Woos Turkey for Refugee Help, Ignoring Rights Crackdown
headline.print_headline: Needing Help, Europe Ignores Turkish Abuses

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
